comments.body: It is one of my Favorited parts of 1.17
Yeah, that was certainly the weirdest part of the announcement for me too, it doesn't make sense and doesn't feel vanilla

I'm really on the fence. I both love it, and feel like it doesn't fit in vanilla as is, and I have no idea how I would change it to improve it. I think it could works... but:

  • You shouldn't be able to get ridiculous loot out of it, like diamond or emerald blocks;
  • The brush needs to make more sense as a new tool in the game
If they actually add this to the game, I don't wanna play anymore.

It’s obvious there gonna add more to it. Be patient and see what it can bloom into. And let’s face it yeah vanilla is changing. But i say as long as it’s going at a slow pace like this, I don’t care. Infact the only reason I came here to comment is to say to everyone bashing the idea. “It’s not the game it used to be” and I’m super glad for that. It’s evolving naturally like every game should. Wanna hate on that kinda progress. Ok. But just know, this idea can turn out to be something really incredible. So go take your icologer/moobloom losing whines all the way down down to the deep dark. Progress is changing, get with the program or don’t update. It makes sense to put archeology in for caves and cliffs, I mean it involves digging so yeah. Like I mean seriously. Some of the stuff they added already felt like a mod. Cause wanna know what mods are? A way for players to put their ideas into a suggestion and make it playable for everyone, it’s basically like this feedback place, but more fun for modders to do.
it seems way to industrial. it’s out of place and they need to either trash the idea or make major changes to it for it to fit in the game
does not feel very true to Minecraft at all, in my opinion. hopefully that will change by release - whether it is removed or changed substantially.

Whilst I agree that it's a little odd of an addition, It isn't such a strange addition to vanilla.

We have already in Vanilla, Ruins, Abandoned Strongholds in multiple worlds, Abandoned Mineshafts, Fossils.

It seems no stranger then Fishing to me.

The clay pots add a collectable element of Minecraft, that was already exciting some of the community, e.g. Rare block hunting, but each update made it harder and harder to collect 'rares' as they all became fairly common.

So whilst it's not something that interests me, I don't think it needs an explanation from Mojang, and it's already been announced.

It also appears to be a way to get (at least gravel) slabs etc for decorative purposes.

Plain and simple: I hate it.

This would have been a neat mod for certain types of packs, but it feels weird, low-quality, and out of place as a part of Vanilla Minecraft. This is not related to, nor does it fit with, any part of Minecraft that has existed thus far.

I like archaeology, and if it feels like a mod, I'd say that's a very good thing. Minecraft needs to stop doing small, safe updates that fit the vanilla theme, and instead go for more daring ideas that deviate from vanilla a bit, as vanilla can get boring.

Although, I'm not a fan of the clay pot fragments being so rare and non-renewable, I wish there are ways to make the archaeology process itself renewable and repeatable, perhaps from brushing common dirt and gravel that is obtained everywhere. And admittedly there are much more exciting ideas out there other than archaeology. Feel free to take inspiration from mods!

To everyone saying Archaeology doesn’t fit, it does. Minecraft is a game about mining and exploring so of course Archaeology should be a feature. Although it’s a new concept, it is thought out but does need some improvements. Ideally instead of the designs being clumped together, it would make more sense if each side individually could be designed instead. Emeralds/Diamonds are a placeholder btw.
I wish the pot have a usability like liquid storage. Lava, milk and water. Would be cool to have some usability.
I dont like the vase design, i think it could be better designed, and i wish it could be dyeable instead of having only terracotta color.
Can we plants a flowers or ancient plants
Like the player burning wool with a flint and steel it the same with te sheep
I never thought of this but now that I hear it it makes perfect sense! Fire burns wool and to get wool you kill sheep so burning sheep shouldn’t drop wool!
they could change to trimmed appearance when on fire showing lost wool.
And maybe it could drop gunpowder or something like that because it kinda looks like ash
Blaze powder and rods would be great loot items in nether fortresses.

this is a good idea, but this would remove the whole idea of trying to find a fortress, if you were able to just get them from bartering there is no need to go find a fortress anymore except to get wither heads, i just dont feel like this would be a good addition

I play with my young daughers who don't like fighting the mobs, so we play on peaceful. We've found nether fortresses in game and collected Nether Wort, but my daughters were upset that they cannot brew potions without blaze powder. It is also not possible to craft Ender Chests in Peaceful.

I think that Piglins should be able to barter for Blaze Powder or Blaze Rods, but maybe as a higher-tier trade. Maybe it could be a random chance for a trade for Gold Blocks (not ingots), or maybe a guaranteed trade for Netherite since it is not as necessary in Peaceful.

Another option would be to have Blaze Powder be a random chest drop in Bastion Remnants, making finding and visiting those more valuable.

Playing on peaceful is a choice and Mojang should allow the game to be completed on any difficulty. Yes, even peaceful.

Blaze rods in peaceful should be obtainable only in Nether fortress loot chests at rate of 1-3 per chest. so you would still have to make a trip to the fortress but not fight blazes for the rods. Also if there are not enough rods in a single fortress you would have to go to another fortress to get sufficient amount to make ender eyes for the end portal frame or for other uses for the rods

I hate hostile mobs which is why when I play survival mode on peaceful difficulty. I really want to go underwater for a long time & explore the oceans of Minecraft. In the old versions of Minecraft like Xbox 360. I could brew potions. But now thanks to updates on Minecraft I cannot brew potions because of the stupid blaze powder. I can obtain items like rotten flesh bones & string. I strongly agree with this opinion. You should be able to at least obtain it in chests. It also makes it unfair to players that are not really good at Minecraft to finish the game by defeating the ender dragon. Because you can find rotten flesh bones & string which is mainly obtained by hostile mobs, it makes the "No blaze rods in peaceful mode idea" stupid & is required for potions which is why it should be removed.

I would like to see them implement a way to have water in the Nether, and to be able to use the same set up as the regular cobblestone generator. Suppose that you you could have water in the Nether only if it was directly on top of blue ice (hypothetically cooling it enough to keep it in from evaporating). I think it would be neat if the same configurations worked similarly, but were dimension dependent, so in the overworld lava and water always make cobblestone, but in the Nether they always make blackstone, and only in the Nether.

Magma creams are the slime's Nether counterpart and it would make sense for magma cream to be used for leads. But along with this I think the magma cream leads should be made with netherite encased string and it would be longer and wouldn't break.
Maybe levitation could be modified to allow for this and a potion added. But I think weeping vines might be too common. Perhaps it could be made from a new drop with Piglin bartering?
And a inversione arrow will be a frigtening weapon in the opening
Perhaps it could be randomly inflicted when you get hurt in the Warped Forest.
TWISTING VINES BOYS. IT MIGHT HAPPEN
I think it would be neat if you would drown as if you were under water when going beyond the sky limit. This would prevent players from going too far up, if this would cause problems.

This should be revisited now we have the Deep Dark biome.  A sort of antigravity trap (splash potion of inversion in a dispenser?) or monster that inflicted the inversion effect would be an awesome addition to the Ancient Cities.  The initial strike could inflict slow fall so as to stop the player from dying by hitting the cave ceiling, but then there'd be the challenge of not falling back to the ground upon the effect ending.  Falls of water/lava could push the player back down, and the levitation effect could do the same.
My only plea is that the player's camera gets flipped so that from his/her perspective, the world itself flipped (just for comfortable gameplay).
I agree that it is too easy but how about instead of sneaking you just have to plant it in tilled soil? Having to shift to plant it isn't very intuitive

I see your point. Of course, Mojang could do whatever they like to solve this small issue, not just what I’ve suggested.
To answer your question, it would be a little strange if berry bushes generated in natural terrain but you can no longer place it on them. I suppose if you till the dirt and plant it, the dirt would eventually turn into grass? But regardless, I see your point and why it’s counter intuitive.

@PMDMCG yeah I like that idea. Having to plant it in tilled soil. It stays tilled maybe through it's first few growth stages then when it finishes fully growing it turns the tilled dirt back to normal dirt/grass
How would it work with Silk Touch?
Heck yeah! really necessary idea. Perhaps it would have to be mutually exclusive with fortune.
It would also be exclusive with silk touch
I was playing thinking exactly that, immediatly came here. I think it should be compatible with Fortune. It wouldn't make sense not to.
this would be cool
it would probably not be possible to put with silk touch, just like you cant have fortune and silk touch

I think some items should turn invisible with you, and some should not. For example, if leather armor was the only armor that would turn invisible with you, there would be a point to using leather armor.

Actually it is in the game. You can disable particles by command.

The whole point of the particles are that you are not entirely invisible. So it is not overpowered (it kinda is).

If some armor would be invisible with you too, that's just too much. Imagine being on a PvP server and get 2 hit by invisible mr fulldiamond.
yes. the invisibility potion does you no good against other platers because you can't get rid of the particles without commands. please add this mojang.
NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO
I think that's exactly right!  The bedrock edition withers are too strong.  mojang and Microsoft, please weaken faster.

me and my friend went to fight the wither boss in our survival world.  First of all, the boss is way too destructive. second of all, the Wither effect lasts way too long when you get hit once.  I battled the wither in full netherite gear with protection 4 and got hit once by the wither, I escaped the area and died.  I died by a single hit to the wither with full netherite gear!! not to mention that when I ran back to get my items back, the wither one shot me every time!  after about 5 attempts I finally ran past the wither and collected a bunch of blocks that clogged up my inventory so i was not able to pick up my items.  and then the wither shot a single hit at me and all my items blew up and I died.  honestly im ready to go into creative and give myself a nether star because it feels impossible to do in bedrock edition.  I also play on a survival realms on minecraft Java edition and I defeat the wither multiple times without dying because the fight is much more balanced and it possible to do on Java.  this really needs to be fixed on bedrock because the fight is way to hard.  I hope someone shares my little rant because this fix is really needed.

I completely agree I just tried to fight the wither on PS4, I died once and so many blocks were on the ground that the game became impossible to play due to lag. I feel like a noob because I’ve been playing in this world for 5 years, I just got up the courage to fight the wither, and it literally made the game unplayable to the point that I had to change the difficulty to peaceful. Also, the first phase is relatively easy, but as soon as it hits the second phase it destroys so many blocks that the lag makes it unplayable.

I have had the same issue, I run a SMP server for bedrock edition and we play on normal difficulty.  The issue is, is that the wither seems to be just as hard in normal difficulty and hard, but the wither is a piece of cake in easy difficulty.  I think that normal difficulty should be a balance between what it is now, and what it is in easy difficulty, maybe make it less destructive, and have the wither effect not last as long, and make the hits not take as much damage.  Of course, keep the wither how it is in hard difficulty.  It is possible, but you need to have quite a few enchanted golden apples and potions to kill it without dying, and make sure that you are AT LEAST 250 blocks away from any builds.  Me and my server members have been concerned that spawn could be destroyed by a wither, even if we are far away and underground.  I feel like the wither SHOULD be a challenge, but you SHOULD NOT have to worry about your builds being destroyed when you are a safe distance away.

Yes, i agree with this. I am pocket edition player, it very hard to fight wither in mobile. Mojang please make bedrock wither same as java edition wither. It is impossible to kill wither in pocket edition. I hope mojang make bedrock wither same as java edition wither

I'm quit on fight wither in bedrock completely!! In my opinion, The wither in bedrock ver. should create to be easier than the java version since devices for bedrock are harder to control. but they made it opposite. Because of that, I'm so frustrated and just wanna quit playing Minecraft on mobile. I wish next up date they should make wither weaker as much as possible.

I agree. I play on Xbox one and due to the amount of destruction it had made it cause the game to become extremely laggy. There for making it almost impossible to fight let alone defeat. If the game can’t handle the boss it should be looked at but what I don’t get is from what I understand is that bedrock exists as it’s for use on less powerful devices so why is the easier wither on Java?

I doubt anyone from Mojang cares, but this issue with lag and the Wither has been an ongoing problem and all I've seen is total silence from Mojang. My son and I just spent two hours trying to knock the Wither down using iron golems, and we had to walk away from the game for a while to cool off because we were so frustrated. The lag made it very difficult to move and impossible to hit the Wither. I don't care how it's fixed, I'd like the issue solved, please. I would love to see anyone from Mojang try to defeat the Wither on an Xbox One once that lag kicks in. Maybe it's eventually do-able, but it's not fun, and I thought the idea of the game was to be fun. I don't care that the Wither is difficult to kill. I care about the lag it generates. Balance it, please, in the direction of allowing players to play with minimal, or preferably no lag.
It's not fair that the wither is THAT strong! Not only that, it's FREAKING LAGGY when it entered the second phase making it nearly impossible to fight. Please make it more balanced

They don’t even need to nerf it just bring back the end portal cheese. I can’t fight the wither on bedrock it just kept going up it hit 500 in the y axis before I ran out of rockets And when I fought it underground it crashed my game, it’s bull crap. Mojang if your reading this please fix your game, ignoring us will be your downfall. Also I play on switch
You can one shot the wither with the mace, making it easier on Bedrock.
what... this really seems like a mod, and would pretty much ruin the game
This would be a good idea to make Minecraft 2 And i mean a second MineCraft

I think the idea of knights being added can be great. We need a mob that can have a more complex combat behavior.
Knights would be passive, if attacked by player the would attack, or they could be tamed by giving them emeralds or other items. Tamed knight would follow the player and attack hostile mobs. They would guard a spot when not following. They would use iron wdapons and armor. That the player could give. If knights are to powerful of an idea, maybe a warrior that uses stone weapons and leather armor. This would not make them to powerful but could add some new mechanics and tactics to combat.
Im a beekeeper in real life but... WHAT ON EARTH IS A KING BEE, THEY DONT EXIST
That is not a bad idea! Makes a nice quality of life update...
I think it would be useful for 1.14 and 1.15
I think that the enchantment should be called "Bone Crushing" and it basically does more damage to humanoid entities, such as witches, illagers, villagers, and players.

bone crusher is a good name too zackeroni9 thanks for sharing!

(eh, but this enchant does not work against players, ONLY illagers. iron gollems and vexes also count as illagers)

I think something like "justification" or "liberation" would be a great name for the anti Illager enchantment considering Illagers are "ill" probably mentally. So for adding the enchantment to do extra damage, it probably does psychic damage; which makes sense considering witches and Evokers have to do with the mind in a sense if you think about it.
also do pillagers

this would send minecraft "under question".(eh, just an idiom.) the fact that minecrafts block does not fall cant be changed easily, not because of programing, look by a simple update (i mean 1.9) many people who loved pvp and action part of minecraft turned into crybabies, now please dont suggest to turn builders into crybabies. i dont wanna more peple have more reasons to leave minecraft community.
I see your reasoning but Minecraft isn’t meant to be 100% realistic. Gravity just... isn’t Minecraft. This idea isn’t good for builders or survival players alike
I see your reasoning but Minecraft isn’t meant to be 100% realistic. Gravity just... isn’t Minecraft. This idea isn’t good for builders or survival players alike
This is just useless, how would you make domes? Realistic sealings? Caves?! Think a little bit before proposing useless ideas
So, you would make domes the same way, except, you would need a pillar in the middle to hold it up , or, if it was connected to a foundation of the building, it would not need a pillar. :)

And again, caves are attached to the whole entire minecraft world and realistic ceilings would be connected to the walls to hold them up and of course that would need a foundation. :) Thank you for your questions and feedback!

how do you wanna add this? think i am jeb(my best example!) and i wanna add this to mc. but how? how can i make blocks understand to stick to each other and dont fall in some conditions, and fall otherwise?scoreboard?nbt tags? would it fill minecraft with millions and millions and millions and millions of different lags? think i made a 1*x*1 pillar. if i put a block in the side of highest block will it fall? if yes, so think about a 1*x*y wall. a single block must fall at this condition too. so, can you explain how we gonna make dome? TAP TAP TAP quick place blocks before they fall!!

So if you placed another block attached to the top of the pillar, no it would not fall because it would be attached to the pillar and it would not fall if attached to the ceiling unless you broke the block in the ceiling holding it up, but if it already was a pillar attached to the floor this would not be a problem, and on occasion, maybe if an illager beast somehow gets in your house and starts jumping to get to you, it’s weight might make the pillar collapse, idk just a mob idea. And if a block is attached to another one somehow, even diagonally it would not fall. There is your answer, if you have any more questions please ask.

😐😐😐😐😐😐😐😐😐😐 i think i got your pain!! you mean blocks must not float, but can stick to each other. ok. mojang this idea is great! remove the end!! end must do not exist! damn with bedwars! dawn with maps! reamove ALL of them.just because of when you punch a log and a tree turns into a group of floating blocks, it must fall! how do you wanna explain this?(he he he... i know whats your answer and ill checkmate you!)
My answer to this is, the end, bedwars and maps, is they would need a game rule in order to float and in the end, bedwars, and skywards etc. there would be no gravity except you falling.

YAH-HAHAHAHA!(devilar laugh) checkmate!!! adding a gamerule for the end? cheating? maybe i generated a world without cheats, now i cant go to the end? ohonoho. what if i generate a normal world with cheats, disable this gamerule (/gamerule gravityavailable false), then teleport to a still non generated part of my world, then set this gamerule to true again? KA-BOOM! {atomic lag incoming, dear citizens please head to the nearst shelters...}. you may say: ok, i retreat. this gamerule is always false and turning it would affect blocks and its optional, so you can go to the end. now can you tell me in which worlds i can set this gamerule to true? only super-flat! so, at the last point, your idea is only useful for some superflat worlds which doesnt have any point on map making. you died!

(oh, and can you explain about liquids? i need more explain EVEN you retreat)

i count your silence as retreat.you lose. your idea is not useful.

(also, imagine i made a very HUGE structure that only connected to the earth with one pillar. then if i break even one block of that pillar, KA-BOOOOOMMMMM! minecraft would crash, and the world may become useless.)

Well I know for a fact in some way it could work and I am not being silent I was just busy. It would work and I don’t know if you live in America, but we have freedom of speech here... can ya pronounce it? And the end would be in space and space does not have gravity lol. And liquids would not float seriously. And no if you broke one block of the pillar it would not fall. My idea is NOT useless but reality. And if the pillar was only one block, then the next block would fall into the space of the block broken and I know someday Mojang will consider this. I’m not done lol so... yea.
Unfortunately folks weren't able to keep things civil and constructive, so we had to lock this thread. Everyone can still vote, though.
What would the effect of quick falling be and why would you want to use it?
What is point of quick falling when you already fall pretty fast on your own.
How would you get it, just corrupting the slow falling potion.
I like the idea and it makes you fall faster.It's usage can be for people who do not want players to jump.also it can be good for dropper maps and pvp.I hope mojang add this effect.
You wouldn't take damage obviously, but why would you use it other than in PvP for ambushes. A great idea though

I had an idea for this once. A potion like this would basically turn you into a projectile, keeping your fall damage at a specific level and dealing blast damage when you land. It would require at least a three-block drop, and would deal damage to you and your armor, but it would add an entertaining way to fight monsters!
Actually, I originally thought it should be activated by crouching in midair, which would make it a little easier to use!
this game is just begging for mouse controls, a simple toggle button for mouse controls in the controls menu would solve this problem
Please add this feature. It would help me play this game easier.

Also, the trees should be more apart and taller, but keep the heart near ground (3-4 blocks above the ground). Add some glow linchen and white glowing muchrooms to make "happy" spots so that the dark corners are more creepy.
I agree, it doing half a heart of damage with 0 armor is a complete Joke

It should not do a lot of damage. It should hit hard, but very slowly and not too hard - just to keep it noticable and unplesant. It should also pierce through armor, so that it still scary in the late game. Maybe it could attack less when the player has less HP, seeing him as less of a threat, or to play with the player more -- it is more intense to run for your life than simply dying.

More damage (A few seconds of Mining Fatigue too?) per hit but have a bit of a cool down between hits. if the Creaking kills a player too quick the tension (and fear factor) will be over. Dealing a heavy blow to the player but giving them just enough time to spin round and stop the Creaking could be more effective. Imagine, Standing in darkness, eyes locked with the Creaking, your health now too low now to take another hit. You could run backwards but any fall will kill you. So desperately cramming pork chops to regenerate health, staring into those glowing eyes, you listen to the zombies getting closer.
I agree to this, the current soundtracks aren't that bad but if Mojang and Microsoft added both C418 and their current music artist it would be amazing, and it will make lots of people happy

I think this would be an idea best for a world you can buy in the marketplace. It would probably need a few more features implemented to make it worth getting. Something like you have to gather items before the pigs kill you and special potatoes can give you boasts.
More of a mod idea.
This is honestly a terrible idea and memorial for techno
There's probably a way to do that on banners using various patterns in the loom.
Yes. This would be amazing. Great idea
thats good idea
Yes, so it is actually blind!
Maybe add stuff when different sounds play.
I just came here to suggest that one. We already have mobs that has unique vision.
Maybe you could only see sounds like a particle where the noise came from
I have also been thinking about this. I would love this as currently there isn't a way to get deepslate in skyblock.
This should totally be a thing to make deepslate renewable and farmable. Currently deepslate suffers from slow mining speeds, so gathering it in large quantities is a nightmare.
Si y también debería tener el modo espectador y la música de fondo (pero que este instalada, automáticamente)
Make it like in java
This makes tons of sense. We should get this in bedrock
I just discovered this and I'm quite disappointed !
I’ve gotten really BoRDe of Minecraft without a lot of animals like real dogs,zeabras,graiffs,and peacocks, and I want more cool animals and possibles!
